# High Precision Laboratory Tables Tender Announcement

## Tender Overview

The National Research Council of Canada, Security and Disruptive Technologies Research Centre (NRC SDT), is soliciting a tender for the supply of high precision laboratory tables to be used in their Photonics Facilities. The tender notice is structured as an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN), allowing interested suppliers to submit a statement of capabilities.

## Requirements

The NRC SDT is seeking to acquire (18) high performance optical tables that meet the requirements outlined in the tender notice. The supplier must provide all necessary tables, operator manuals, and peripherals to ensure the system works in accordance with the Mandatory Technical Requirements.

### Key Requirements

* Supply of 18 high performance optical tables as described in Table 1
* Installation and training completed within 130 days of contract signing
* 12-month warranty

## Assessment Criteria

Interested suppliers must demonstrate, through their statement of capabilities, that their product/equipment/system meets the requirements outlined in the tender notice. The criteria for assessment are as follows:

* Response to the Mandatory Technical Requirements
* Supply chain management and quality control processes
* Product/instrument/system compatibility and integration
* Installation, training, and commissioning capabilities

## Trade Agreements and Exclusions

The tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the World Trade Organization – Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP). The use of a pre-identified supplier is justified due to the unique technical requirements and proprietary designs associated with the project.

## Important Dates

* Tender closing date: April 29th, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST
* Pre-identified supplier: MKS Spectra-Physics

## Contact Information

Suppliers interested in submitting a statement of capabilities should contact:

Paul Hewitt
National Research Council Canada
Senior Contracting Officer
Email: [Paul.Hewitt@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Paul.Hewitt@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca)
Phone: (343) 573-1068
